scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: O worthy prince, dishonour not your eye

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: By throwing it on any other object

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Till you have heard me in my true complaint

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: And given me justice, justice, justice, justice!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Relate your wrongs; in what? by whom? be brief.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Here is Lord Angelo shall give you justice:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Reveal yourself to him.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: O worthy duke,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: You bid me seek redemption of the devil:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Hear me yourself; for that which I must speak

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Must either punish me, not being believed,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Or wring redress from you. Hear me, O hear me, here!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: My lord, her wits, I fear me, are not firm:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: She hath been a suitor to me for her brother

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Cut off by course of justice,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: By course of justice!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And she will speak most bitterly and strange.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Most strange, but yet most truly, will I speak:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That Angelo's forsworn; is it not strange?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That Angelo's a murderer; is 't not strange?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That Angelo is an adulterous thief,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: An hypocrite, a virgin-violator;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Is it not strange and strange?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Nay, it is ten times strange.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: It is not truer he is Angelo

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Than this is all as true as it is strange:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Nay, it is ten times true; for truth is truth

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: To the end of reckoning.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Away with her! Poor soul,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: She speaks this in the infirmity of sense.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: O prince, I conjure thee, as thou believest

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: There is another comfort than this world,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That thou neglect me not, with that opinion

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That I am touch'd with madness! Make not impossible

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That which but seems unlike: 'tis not impossible

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: But one, the wicked'st caitiff on the ground,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: May seem as shy, as grave, as just, as absolute

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: As Angelo; even so may Angelo,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: In all his dressings, characts, titles, forms,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Be an arch-villain; believe it, royal prince:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: If he be less, he's nothing; but he's more,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Had I more name for badness.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: By mine honesty,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: If she be mad,--as I believe no other,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Her madness hath the oddest frame of sense,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Such a dependency of thing on thing,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: As e'er I heard in madness.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: O gracious duke,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Harp not on that, nor do not banish reason

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: For inequality; but let your reason serve

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: To make the truth appear where it seems hid,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: And hide the false seems true.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Many that are not mad

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Have, sure, more lack of reason. What would you say?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: I am the sister of one Claudio,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Condemn'd upon the act of fornication

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: To lose his head; condemn'd by Angelo:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: I, in probation of a sisterhood,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Was sent to by my brother; one Lucio

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: As then the messenger,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: That's I, an't like your grace:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: I came to her from Claudio, and desired her

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: To try her gracious fortune with Lord Angelo

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: For her poor brother's pardon.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That's he indeed.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: You were not bid to speak.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: No, my good lord;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Nor wish'd to hold my peace.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I wish you now, then;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Pray you, take note of it: and when you have

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: A business for yourself, pray heaven you then

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Be perfect.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: I warrant your honour.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: The warrants for yourself; take heed to't.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: This gentleman told somewhat of my tale,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Right.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: It may be right; but you are i' the wrong

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To speak before your time. Proceed.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: I went

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: To this pernicious caitiff deputy,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That's somewhat madly spoken.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Pardon it;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: The phrase is to the matter.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Mended again. The matter; proceed.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: In brief, to set the needless process by,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: How I persuaded, how I pray'd, and kneel'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: How he refell'd me, and how I replied,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: For this was of much length,--the vile conclusion

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: I now begin with grief and shame to utter:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: He would not, but by gift of my chaste body

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: To his concupiscible intemperate lust,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Release my brother; and, after much debatement,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: My sisterly remorse confutes mine honour,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: And I did yield to him: but the next morn betimes,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: His purpose surfeiting, he sends a warrant

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: For my poor brother's head.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: This is most likely!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: O, that it were as like as it is true!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: By heaven, fond wretch, thou knowist not what thou speak'st,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Or else thou art suborn'd against his honour

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: In hateful practise. First, his integrity

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Stands without blemish. Next, it imports no reason

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That with such vehemency he should pursue

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Faults proper to himself: if he had so offended,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: He would have weigh'd thy brother by himself

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And not have cut him off. Some one hath set you on:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Confess the truth, and say by whose advice

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thou camest here to complain.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: And is this all?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Then, O you blessed ministers above,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Keep me in patience, and with ripen'd time

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Unfold the evil which is here wrapt up

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: In countenance! Heaven shield your grace from woe,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: As I, thus wrong'd, hence unbelieved go!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I know you'ld fain be gone. An officer!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To prison with her! Shall we thus permit

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: A blasting and a scandalous breath to fall

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: On him so near us? This needs must be a practise.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Who knew of Your intent and coming hither?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: One that I would were here, Friar Lodowick.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: A ghostly father, belike. Who knows that Lodowick?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: My lord, I know him; 'tis a meddling friar;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: I do not like the man: had he been lay, my lord

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: For certain words he spake against your grace

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: In your retirement, I had swinged him soundly.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Words against me? this is a good friar, belike!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And to set on this wretched woman here

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Against our substitute! Let this friar be found.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: But yesternight, my lord, she and that friar,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: I saw them at the prison: a saucy friar,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: A very scurvy fellow.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Blessed be your royal grace!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: I have stood by, my lord, and I have heard

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Your royal ear abused. First, hath this woman

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Most wrongfully accused your substitute,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Who is as free from touch or soil with her

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: As she from one ungot.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: We did believe no less.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Know you that Friar Lodowick that she speaks of?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: I know him for a man divine and holy;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Not scurvy, nor a temporary meddler,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: As he's reported by this gentleman;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: And, on my trust, a man that never yet

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Did, as he vouches, misreport your grace.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: My lord, most villanously; believe it.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Well, he in time may come to clear himself;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: But at this instant he is sick my lord,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Of a strange fever. Upon his mere request,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Being come to knowledge that there was complaint

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Intended 'gainst Lord Angelo, came I hither,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: To speak, as from his mouth, what he doth know

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Is true and false; and what he with his oath

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: And all probation will make up full clear,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Whensoever he's convented. First, for this woman.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: To justify this worthy nobleman,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: So vulgarly and personally accused,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Her shall you hear disproved to her eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Till she herself confess it.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Good friar, let's hear it.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Do you not smile at this, Lord Angelo?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: O heaven, the vanity of wretched fools!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Give us some seats. Come, cousin Angelo;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: In this I'll be impartial; be you judge

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Of your own cause. Is this the witness, friar?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: First, let her show her face, and after speak.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Pardon, my lord; I will not show my face

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Until my husband bid me.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: What, are you married?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: No, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Are you a maid?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: No, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: A widow, then?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Neither, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Why, you are nothing then: neither maid, widow, nor wife?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: My lord, she may be a punk; for many of them are

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: neither maid, widow, nor wife.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Silence that fellow: I would he had some cause

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To prattle for himself.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Well, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: My lord; I do confess I ne'er was married;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: And I confess besides I am no maid:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: I have known my husband; yet my husband

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Knows not that ever he knew me.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: He was drunk then, my lord: it can be no better.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: For the benefit of silence, would thou wert so too!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Well, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: This is no witness for Lord Angelo.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Now I come to't my lord

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: She that accuses him of fornication,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: In self-same manner doth accuse my husband,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: And charges him my lord, with such a time

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: When I'll depose I had him in mine arms

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: With all the effect of love.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Charges she more than me?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Not that I know.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: No? you say your husband.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Why, just, my lord, and that is Angelo,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Who thinks he knows that he ne'er knew my body,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: But knows he thinks that he knows Isabel's.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: This is a strange abuse. Let's see thy face.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: My husband bids me; now I will unmask.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: This is that face, thou cruel Angelo,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Which once thou sworest was worth the looking on;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: This is the hand which, with a vow'd contract,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Was fast belock'd in thine; this is the body

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: That took away the match from Isabel,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: And did supply thee at thy garden-house

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: In her imagined person.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Know you this woman?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Carnally, she says.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Sirrah, no more!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Enough, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: My lord, I must confess I know this woman:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And five years since there was some speech of marriage

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Betwixt myself and her; which was broke off,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Partly for that her promised proportions

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Came short of composition, but in chief

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: For that her reputation was disvalued

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: In levity: since which time of five years

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I never spake with her, saw her, nor heard from her,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Upon my faith and honour.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Noble prince,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: As there comes light from heaven and words from breath,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: As there is sense in truth and truth in virtue,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: I am affianced this man's wife as strongly

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: As words could make up vows: and, my good lord,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: But Tuesday night last gone in's garden-house

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: He knew me as a wife. As this is true,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Let me in safety raise me from my knees

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Or else for ever be confixed here,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: A marble monument!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I did but smile till now:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Now, good my lord, give me the scope of justice

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: My patience here is touch'd. I do perceive

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: These poor informal women are no more

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: But instruments of some more mightier member

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: That sets them on: let me have way, my lord,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: To find this practise out.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Ay, with my heart

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And punish them to your height of pleasure.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thou foolish friar, and thou pernicious woman,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Compact with her that's gone, think'st thou thy oaths,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Though they would swear down each particular saint,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Were testimonies against his worth and credit

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That's seal'd in approbation? You, Lord Escalus,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Sit with my cousin; lend him your kind pains

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To find out this abuse, whence 'tis derived.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: There is another friar that set them on;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Let him be sent for.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Would he were here, my lord! for he indeed

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Hath set the women on to this complaint:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: Your provost knows the place where he abides

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: FRIAR PETER
line: And he may fetch him.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Go do it instantly.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And you, my noble and well-warranted cousin,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Whom it concerns to hear this matter forth,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Do with your injuries as seems you best,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: In any chastisement: I for a while will leave you;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: But stir not you till you have well determined

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Upon these slanderers.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: My lord, we'll do it throughly.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Signior Lucio, did not you say you knew that

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Friar Lodowick to be a dishonest person?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: 'Cucullus non facit monachum:' honest in nothing

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: but in his clothes; and one that hath spoke most

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: villanous speeches of the duke.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: We shall entreat you to abide here till he come and

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: enforce them against him: we shall find this friar a

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: notable fellow.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: As any in Vienna, on my word.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Call that same Isabel here once again; I would speak with her.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Pray you, my lord, give me leave to question; you

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: shall see how I'll handle her.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Not better than he, by her own report.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Say you?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Marry, sir, I think, if you handled her privately,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: she would sooner confess: perchance, publicly,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: she'll be ashamed.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: I will go darkly to work with her.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: That's the way; for women are light at midnight.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Come on, mistress: here's a gentlewoman denies all

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: that you have said.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: My lord, here comes the rascal I spoke of; here with

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: the provost.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: In very good time: speak not you to him till we

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: call upon you.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Mum.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Come, sir: did you set these women on to slander

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Lord Angelo? they have confessed you did.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: 'Tis false.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: How! know you where you are?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Respect to your great place! and let the devil

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Be sometime honour'd for his burning throne!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Where is the duke? 'tis he should hear me speak.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: The duke's in us; and we will hear you speak:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Look you speak justly.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Boldly, at least. But, O, poor souls,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Come you to seek the lamb here of the fox?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Good night to your redress! Is the duke gone?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Then is your cause gone too. The duke's unjust,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thus to retort your manifest appeal,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And put your trial in the villain's mouth

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Which here you come to accuse.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: This is the rascal; this is he I spoke of.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Why, thou unreverend and unhallow'd friar,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Is't not enough thou hast suborn'd these women

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: To accuse this worthy man, but, in foul mouth

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: And in the witness of his proper ear,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: To call him villain? and then to glance from him

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: To the duke himself, to tax him with injustice?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Take him hence; to the rack with him! We'll touse you

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Joint by joint, but we will know his purpose.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: What 'unjust'!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Be not so hot; the duke

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Dare no more stretch this finger of mine than he

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Dare rack his own: his subject am I not,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Nor here provincial. My business in this state

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Made me a looker on here in Vienna,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Where I have seen corruption boil and bubble

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Till it o'er-run the stew; laws for all faults,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: But faults so countenanced, that the strong statutes

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Stand like the forfeits in a barber's shop,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: As much in mock as mark.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Slander to the state! Away with him to prison!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: What can you vouch against him, Signior Lucio?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Is this the man that you did tell us of?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: 'Tis he, my lord. Come hither, goodman baldpate:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: do you know me?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I remember you, sir, by the sound of your voice: I

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: met you at the prison, in the absence of the duke.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: O, did you so? And do you remember what you said of the duke?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Most notedly, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Do you so, sir? And was the duke a fleshmonger, a

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: fool, and a coward, as you then reported him to be?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: You must, sir, change persons with me, ere you make

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: that my report: you, indeed, spoke so of him; and

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: much more, much worse.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: O thou damnable fellow! Did not I pluck thee by the

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: nose for thy speeches?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I protest I love the duke as I love myself.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Hark, how the villain would close now, after his

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: treasonable abuses!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Such a fellow is not to be talked withal. Away with

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: him to prison! Where is the provost? Away with him

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: to prison! lay bolts enough upon him: let him

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: speak no more. Away with those giglots too, and

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: with the other confederate companion!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To Provost  Stay, sir; stay awhile.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: What, resists he? Help him, Lucio.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Come, sir; come, sir; come, sir; foh, sir! Why, you

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: bald-pated, lying rascal, you must be hooded, must

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: you? Show your knave's visage, with a pox to you!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: show your sheep-biting face, and be hanged an hour!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Will't not off?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thou art the first knave that e'er madest a duke.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: First, provost, let me bail these gentle three.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Sneak not away, sir; for the friar and you

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Must have a word anon. Lay hold on him.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: This may prove worse than hanging.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To ESCALUS  What you have spoke I pardon: sit you down:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: We'll borrow place of him.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Sir, by your leave.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Hast thou or word, or wit, or impudence,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That yet can do thee office? If thou hast,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Rely upon it till my tale be heard,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And hold no longer out.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: O my dread lord,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I should be guiltier than my guiltiness,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: To think I can be undiscernible,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: When I perceive your grace, like power divine,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Hath look'd upon my passes. Then, good prince,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: No longer session hold upon my shame,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: But let my trial be mine own confession:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Immediate sentence then and sequent death

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Is all the grace I beg.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Come hither, Mariana.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Say, wast thou e'er contracted to this woman?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I was, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Go take her hence, and marry her instantly.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Do you the office, friar; which consummate,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Return him here again. Go with him, provost.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: My lord, I am more amazed at his dishonour

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Than at the strangeness of it.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Come hither, Isabel.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Your friar is now your prince: as I was then

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Advertising and holy to your business,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Not changing heart with habit, I am still

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Attorney'd at your service.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: O, give me pardon,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That I, your vassal, have employ'd and pain'd

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Your unknown sovereignty!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: You are pardon'd, Isabel:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And now, dear maid, be you as free to us.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And you may marvel why I obscured myself,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Labouring to save his life, and would not rather

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Make rash remonstrance of my hidden power

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Than let him so be lost. O most kind maid,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: It was the swift celerity of his death,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Which I did think with slower foot came on,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That brain'd my purpose. But, peace be with him!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That life is better life, past fearing death,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Than that which lives to fear: make it your comfort,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: So happy is your brother.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: I do, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: For this new-married man approaching here,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Whose salt imagination yet hath wrong'd

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Your well defended honour, you must pardon

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: For Mariana's sake: but as he adjudged your brother,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Being criminal, in double violation

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Of sacred chastity and of promise-breach

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thereon dependent, for your brother's life,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: The very mercy of the law cries out

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Most audible, even from his proper tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: 'An Angelo for Claudio, death for death!'

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Haste still pays haste, and leisure answers leisure;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Like doth quit like, and MEASURE still FOR MEASURE.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Then, Angelo, thy fault's thus manifested;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Which, though thou wouldst deny, denies thee vantage.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: We do condemn thee to the very block

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Where Claudio stoop'd to death, and with like haste.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Away with him!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: O my most gracious lord,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: I hope you will not mock me with a husband.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: It is your husband mock'd you with a husband.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Consenting to the safeguard of your honour,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I thought your marriage fit; else imputation,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: For that he knew you, might reproach your life

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And choke your good to come; for his possessions,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Although by confiscation they are ours,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: We do instate and widow you withal,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To buy you a better husband.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: O my dear lord,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: I crave no other, nor no better man.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Never crave him; we are definitive.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Gentle my liege,--

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: You do but lose your labour.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Away with him to death!

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Now, sir, to you.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: O my good lord! Sweet Isabel, take my part;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Lend me your knees, and all my life to come

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: I'll lend you all my life to do you service.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Against all sense you do importune her:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Should she kneel down in mercy of this fact,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Her brother's ghost his paved bed would break,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And take her hence in horror.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Isabel,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Sweet Isabel, do yet but kneel by me;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Hold up your hands, say nothing; I'll speak all.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: They say, best men are moulded out of faults;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: And, for the most, become much more the better

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: For being a little bad: so may my husband.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: O Isabel, will you not lend a knee?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: He dies for Claudio's death.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Most bounteous sir,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Look, if it please you, on this man condemn'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: As if my brother lived: I partly think

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: A due sincerity govern'd his deeds,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Till he did look on me: since it is so,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Let him not die. My brother had but justice,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: In that he did the thing for which he died:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: For Angelo,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: His act did not o'ertake his bad intent,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: And must be buried but as an intent

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: That perish'd by the way: thoughts are no subjects;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ISABELLA
line: Intents but merely thoughts.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: MARIANA
line: Merely, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Your suit's unprofitable; stand up, I say.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I have bethought me of another fault.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Provost, how came it Claudio was beheaded

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: At an unusual hour?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: It was commanded so.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Had you a special warrant for the deed?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: No, my good lord; it was by private message.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: For which I do discharge you of your office:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Give up your keys.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: Pardon me, noble lord:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: I thought it was a fault, but knew it not;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: Yet did repent me, after more advice;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: For testimony whereof, one in the prison,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: That should by private order else have died,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: I have reserved alive.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: What's he?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: His name is Barnardine.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I would thou hadst done so by Claudio.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Go fetch him hither; let me look upon him.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: I am sorry, one so learned and so wise

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: As you, Lord Angelo, have still appear'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: Should slip so grossly, both in the heat of blood.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ESCALUS
line: And lack of temper'd judgment afterward.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I am sorry that such sorrow I procure:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And so deep sticks it in my penitent heart

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: That I crave death more willingly than mercy;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: ANGELO
line: 'Tis my deserving, and I do entreat it.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Which is that Barnardine?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: This, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: There was a friar told me of this man.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Sirrah, thou art said to have a stubborn soul.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That apprehends no further than this world,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And squarest thy life according. Thou'rt condemn'd:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: But, for those earthly faults, I quit them all;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And pray thee take this mercy to provide

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: For better times to come. Friar, advise him;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I leave him to your hand. What muffled fellow's that?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: This is another prisoner that I saved.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: Who should have died when Claudio lost his head;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: Provost
line: As like almost to Claudio as himself.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: To ISABELLA  If he be like your brother, for his sake

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Is he pardon'd; and, for your lovely sake,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Give me your hand and say you will be mine.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: He is my brother too: but fitter time for that.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: By this Lord Angelo perceives he's safe;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Methinks I see a quickening in his eye.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Well, Angelo, your evil quits you well:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Look that you love your wife; her worth worth yours.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I find an apt remission in myself;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And yet here's one in place I cannot pardon.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: You, sirrah, that knew me for a fool, a coward,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: One all of luxury, an ass, a madman;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Wherein have I so deserved of you,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: That you extol me thus?

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: 'Faith, my lord. I spoke it but according to the

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: trick. If you will hang me for it, you may; but I

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: had rather it would please you I might be whipt.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Whipt first, sir, and hanged after.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Proclaim it, provost, round about the city.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Is any woman wrong'd by this lewd fellow,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: As I have heard him swear himself there's one

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Whom he begot with child, let her appear,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And he shall marry her: the nuptial finish'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Let him be whipt and hang'd.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: I beseech your highness, do not marry me to a whore.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Your highness said even now, I made you a duke:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: good my lord, do not recompense me in making me a cuckold.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Upon mine honour, thou shalt marry her.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thy slanders I forgive; and therewithal

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Remit thy other forfeits. Take him to prison;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: And see our pleasure herein executed.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: Marrying a punk, my lord, is pressing to death,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: LUCIO
line: whipping, and hanging.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Slandering a prince deserves it.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: She, Claudio, that you wrong'd, look you restore.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Joy to you, Mariana! Love her, Angelo:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I have confess'd her and I know her virtue.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thanks, good friend Escalus, for thy much goodness:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: There's more behind that is more gratulate.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Thanks, provost, for thy care and secrecy:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: We shill employ thee in a worthier place.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Forgive him, Angelo, that brought you home

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: The head of Ragozine for Claudio's:

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: The offence pardons itself. Dear Isabel,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: I have a motion much imports your good;

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: Whereto if you'll a willing ear incline,

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: What's mine is yours and what is yours is mine.

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: So, bring us to our palace; where we'll show

scene: SCENE I.  The city gate.
speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
line: What's yet behind, that's meet you all should know.
